title: Multiple imputations by two-level model
text: Suppose mm studies evaluate diagnostic accuracy test. iith study, let TPi\mbox{TP}_i: number true positives FNi\mbox{FN}_i: number false negatives FPi\mbox{FP}_i: number false positives TNi\mbox{TN}_i: number true negatives data wish collect =1,…,mi=1,\ldots, m. Write Ni=TPi+FNiN_i=\mbox{TP}_i+\mbox{FN}_i, number cases; N‾=FPi+TNi\bar N_i=\mbox{FP}_i + \mbox{TN}_i, number non-cases; ni=Ni+N‾in_i = N_i + \bar N_i, total sample size. Let pip_i denote sensitivity, qiq_i specificity, πi\pi_i prevalence cases iith study. missing data, can easily estimate p̂=TPi/Ni\hat p_i=\mbox{TP}_i/N_i, q̂=TNi/N‾\hat q_i=\mbox{TN}_i/\bar N_i, π̂=Ni/ni\hat\pi_i=N_i/n_i, respectively. can also feed entire data (TPi,FNi,FPi,TNi)(\mbox{TP}_i, \mbox{FN}_i, \mbox{FP}_i, \mbox{TN}_i)(=1,…,m)(=1,\ldots, m) standard software, e.g., mada (Sousa-Pinto 2022), meta-analysis.

title: Multiple imputations by two-level model
text: Consider scenario non-cases study ii, FNi\mbox{FN}_i, TNi=\mbox{TN}_i=NA. example: aim fill missing values FNi\mbox{FN}_i TNi\mbox{TN}_i multiple imputations (MI).
code: library(mtroc) uts #>            TP FN FP  TN #> Ahn        19  0 NA  NA #> Bock        5  5  2  17 #> Chung       5  0 48 114 #> Cordoba    21  1 NA  NA #> Espinosa    5  0 NA  NA #> Haliloglu   3  0  1  73 #> Langer     57 17 NA  NA #> Liberman    6  0 NA  NA #> Nishanova  26  4 NA  NA #> Obenauer    2  2  0  23 #> Oh          9  0 NA  NA #> Qian       50  1 63  92 #> Reyes      32  1 NA  NA #> Robbins     4  0 17 101 #> Taskin     47  0 NA  NA #> Taylor     21  0 NA  NA #> Yang       21  0 NA  NA #> Myers      33  0 NA  NA #> Taron      19  0 NA  NA #> Son         6  0  6  23 #> Jafari     31  0 NA  NA #> Wang      110 18 NA  NA

title: Multiple imputations by two-level model
text: can think data generated two stages. First, total sample size nin_i, relative size NiN_i vs N‾\bar N_i determined prevalence πi\pi_i. Second, given NiN_i N‾\bar N_i, relative size TPi\mbox{TP}_i vs FNi\mbox{FN}_i, FPi\mbox{FP}_i vs TNi\mbox{TN}_i, determined sensitivity pip_i specificity qiq_i, respectively. leads us posit two-level model prevalence sensitivity-specificity relationship: first allows us impute size cases non-cases; second impute specificity sensitivity (vice versa).
